documents.document: Ridin’ that oscillator from angry to sad and back again.
There may not be much I can do about the ongoing American horror show, but this I can do.
idk about you, fellow kiwis, but I feel some angry letters coming on
So to be clear we are spending 🇳🇿 taxpayer 💰 on a man who got a fascist elected, to curry favour with said fascist. https://t.co/9Krp2ZGjq6
@tiffanyarment I have found @dansinker’s maxim useful for this: “Don’t let Trump take your joy.”
@svs …yes. That is how strikes work. https://t.co/05YtIlNudM
@svs it’s got nothing to do with surge pricing. The taxi drivers union went on strike against the deportations and Uber were strike-breaking
this is very good advice from an avocado https://t.co/mer2Cu5E76
Consider what this reveals about the Tory world-view.
They cannot imagine anyone being upset by the Muslim ban for reasons other than personal inconvenience. https://t.co/wwRn3m0luw
…that if you were an amoral sociopath who hated the US gov’t and wanted to destroy it, supporting Trump would be exactly how you did so.
But I’m haunted by a joke I made about Peter Thiel, back when it seemed absurd that Trump would win…
Or maybe we’re living Stephen Skowronek’s nightmare and will survive Trump only to pretend he wasn’t a catastrophic institutional breakdown.
Maybe I’m wrong and the US will have the wherewithal to reconstitute itself from whatever is left after the next 2/4/8 years.
Note that Denmark recently announced it was naming an ambassador to these companies. https://t.co/Rk5OCh8wyY
…which is to say, to the instrument by which people govern themselves, flawed $2 shop junk though that instrument may sometimes be.
But that implies the further inscription of these big-ass multinationals as organisms which are not subject to the state…
In the tech world lots of people (me included, to an extent) want the big SV companies to become sites of extra-state resistance.
So I end up at the idea that the only way to stop this is to break the power of USG. And not in a nice, surgical way.
You could fight a running rear guard action, lawsuit by lawsuit, but lawsuits take a long time and you’d lose at least half.
(I no longer believe the cGOP will impeach Trump as soon as they think they can get away with it. I think they’re cowed.)
How can this be stopped so it stays stopped? You could impeach Trump, but the spineless shitfucks in the congressional GOP never will.
…and we have only been saved from that by the rank incompetence of Trump’s people.
…one thing that’s come through in the analyses I’ve read is that 80% of this could have been done completely legally with no recourse…
So right now I’m thinking: how does this end? Hopefully, the EO gets struck down as the unconstitutional, racist garbage that it is, but…
@dphiffer This is a tiny drop of wonderful news in an ocean of horror.
I’ll tell you what, though, the I-cannot-believe-your-bullshit look on John Lewis’s face is giving me life. https://t.co/ElasRV8gzd
I wasn’t kidding about him and Franz von Papen. https://t.co/fC7IN5XVeC
This dumb motherfucker doesn’t even realise he’s served his purpose and is no longer relevant.… https://t.co/YnSXYLUxio
I can think of no more American act than to sue the motherfucker until he shrieks. https://t.co/Gtn1MWjJij
@Kiwiseabreeze I have this feeling so hard.
@roowoo IT REALLY IS. Happiest discovery of the last couple of months.
And this intrigues me because it leaves me wondering how that fits into his twisted worldview. What’s different about it?
He’s taken concrete steps towards all the other ones I can think of, but waved off suggestions of prosecuting her.
If I’m not mistaken, the only outrageously fascist thing from the campaign Trump has indicated he WON’T do is hounding Hillary into prison.
@godtributes Tribs, you are god damn right.
New Missy Elliott video! And it's as gloriously mad as ever. https://t.co/KUcC1XhsLz
Tool I am using constantly that I would not have predicted I would: Slack posts.
All this and more, today in Keith Angrily Skims His RSS Feeds.
I wonder if the UK PM abasing themselves before Trump was what Farage et al had in mind for when they ✨reclaimed sovereignty✨?
If I never see another solemn thumb-suck on the virtues of ~~disconnecting~~ it will be too soon.
@tiffanyarment Happy Tiffday!
@PolarBearFarm That’s like saying computers are not useful. It’s a meaninglessly broad generalization about a set of tools.
But that thing comes straight out of the world of PRINCE2, of control and legibility. It’s an antithetical value system in trendy drag.
If Agile™ is anything useful at all it’s a realisation of certain values about flexibility, collaboration, and velocity.
Researching agile planning methods and I fell into this abominable shithole again. https://t.co/NXeRsOr7Ll
In Wellington specifically.
Is there something like Rails Girls for someone (not me, obviously) wanting to learn JS?
@gnat White carpet from a Russian hotel room after Trump has stayed there.
@dingfelder I have the opposite problem: sitting for long periods kills mine.
@agentK Bad assumption, unfortunately.
Y'all should feel free, nay, besought to offer recommendations on good standing desk mats.
I have a Microsoft Natural Keyboard and a standing desk now and I feel like a new man. A new, much sorer-hamstringed man.
Reminder that Julian Assange is a self-involved narcissist. https://t.co/jz3YBRXCPJ
feature request: an anti-immigration party advocating discrimination against rich white assholes
Isn’t there a “fit and proper person” test for naturalisation? https://t.co/44UCdIvSkg
So we’ve been bickering about punching Nazis for about 48 hours now in case you were wondering how Trump won.

It appears that this was my 70,000th tweet.

That sounds glib, but seriously—we can tolerate differences in values while uniting around the fact that we have any at all.

I love BBEdit to bits, but its lack of split-screen support (and the complicated technical debt implied thereby) is infuriating.
My Instagram timeline is wall-to-wall march selfies. Including some from Helen Mirren.
@saniac I haven’t seen this, but I assume it is a new way of dressing up “drink in moderation”?
It is my fond hope that somewhere in one of the crowds today there is a sign reading “BRIDGE PLAYERS BID 4 NO TRUMP”.
“Pay no attention to what white men on Twitter have to say” continues to be a useful heuristic. (And yes, that includes me.)
Do not make the mistake of thinking the behaviour of any other person can in any way condition or constrain Trump’s behaviour.
Also, getting baited into hot takes on isolated incidents is a sucker’s game.

The bizarre dystopian story he tells about crime, for example, I would bet he really believes to be true.
A thing we will probably never know: which things Trump knows he is lying about, and which things he genuinely believes.
